016
017package org.parboiled.buffers;
018
019import org.parboiled.support.IndexRange;
020import org.parboiled.support.Position;
021
022import java.util.Arrays;
023import static imagingbook.parboiled.common.Preconditions.*;
024
025/**
026 * An InputBuffer wrapping another InputBuffer and providing for the ability to insert (and undo) characters at
027 * certain index positions. Inserted chars do not appear in extracted text and have the same positions as the
028 * original chars at their indices.
029 * Note that this implementation is optimized for a rather small number of insertions and will perform badly with
030 * a large number of insertions.
031 */
032public class MutableInputBuffer implements InputBuffer {
033    private final InputBuffer buffer;
034    private int[] inserts = new int[0];
035    private char[] chars = new char[0];
036
037    public MutableInputBuffer(InputBuffer buffer) {
038        this.buffer = buffer;
039    }
040
041    public char charAt(int index) {
042        int j = Arrays.binarySearch(inserts, index);
043        if (j >= 0) return chars[j];
044        return buffer.charAt(index + (j + 1));
045    }
046
047    public boolean test(int index, char[] characters) {
048        throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
049    }
050
051    public Position getPosition(int index) {
052        return buffer.getPosition(map(index));
053    }
054
055    public int getOriginalIndex(int index) {
056        return buffer.getOriginalIndex(map(index));
057    }
058
059    public String extractLine(int lineNumber) {
060        return buffer.extractLine(lineNumber);
061    }
062
063    public String extract(int start, int end) {
064        return buffer.extract(map(start), map(end));
065    }
066
067    public String extract(IndexRange range) {
068        return buffer.extract(map(range.start), map(range.end));
069    }
070
071    public int getLineCount() {
072        return buffer.getLineCount();
073    }
074
075    private int map(int index) {
076        int j = Arrays.binarySearch(inserts, index);
077        if (j < 0) j = -(j + 1);
078        return index - j;
079    }
080
081    public void insertChar(int index, char c) {
082        int j = Arrays.binarySearch(inserts, index);
083        if (j < 0) j = -(j + 1);
084
085        char[] newChars = new char[chars.length + 1];
086        System.arraycopy(chars, 0, newChars, 0, j);
087        newChars[j] = c;
088        System.arraycopy(chars, j, newChars, j + 1, chars.length - j);
089        chars = newChars;
090
091        int[] newInserts = new int[inserts.length + 1];
092        System.arraycopy(inserts, 0, newInserts, 0, j);
093        newInserts[j] = index;
094        for (int i = j; i < inserts.length; i++) {
095            newInserts[i + 1] = inserts[i] + 1;
096        }
097        inserts = newInserts;
098    }
099
100    public char undoCharInsertion(int index) {
101        int j = Arrays.binarySearch(inserts, index);
102        checkArgument(j >= 0, "Cannot undo a non-existing insertion");
103        char removedChar = chars[j];
104
105        char[] newChars = new char[chars.length - 1];
106        System.arraycopy(chars, 0, newChars, 0, j);
107        System.arraycopy(chars, j + 1, newChars, j, newChars.length - j);
108        chars = newChars;
109
110        int[] newInserts = new int[inserts.length - 1];
111        System.arraycopy(inserts, 0, newInserts, 0, j);
112        for (int i = j + 1; i < inserts.length; i++) {
113            newInserts[i - 1] = inserts[i] - 1;
114        }
115        inserts = newInserts;
116        return removedChar;
117    }
118    
119    public void replaceInsertedChar(int index, char c) {
120        int j = Arrays.binarySearch(inserts, index);
121        checkArgument(j >= 0, "Can only replace chars that were previously inserted");
122        chars[j] = c;
123    }
124}
